title: How to Make Gluten Free Apple Blueberry Cupcakes

steps.headline: Cream together the butter and sugar in a medium bowl with an electric mixer.
Add the egg to the butter mixture and beat until it's all incorporated.
Sift gluten free flour, baking soda, and baking powder together through a fine metal sieve in a separate medium bowl.
Warm up the soy milk in a microwavable cup for 15 seconds on high in the microwave.
Add about 1/3 of the sifted ingredients into the creamed butter mixture and beat them on low speed until they're just combined.
Add 1/4 cup of the soy milk into the mixture next, and beat until it's blended.
Add another 1/3 of the sifted ingredients into the mixture and beat on low until just combined.
Add another 1/4 cup of the soy milk to the mixture and mix it into the mixture.
Add the remaining dry ingredients into the mixture and beat until just combined.
Add the rest of the milk to the mixture and mix it until it's combined.
Use a rubber spatula to fold in half of the blueberries and all of your grated apple into the mixture.
Spoon the mixture into the muffin tins.
steps.description: Each muffin cup should be about 3/4 filled to the top.

steps.headline: Arrange the remaining blueberries on top of each cupcake.
Bake your cupcakes for 12 to 15 minutes.
Use a toothpick to check if they're done.
Take the cupcakes out of the oven and let them sit on your counter for 10 minutes before taking them out of the tin.
Serve them with a hot cup of tea and a few fresh berries as garnish.

text: Prepare the Batter Cream together the butter and sugar in a medium bowl with an electric mixer.  Add the egg to the butter mixture and beat until it's all incorporated.  Sift gluten free flour, baking soda, and baking powder together through a fine metal sieve in a separate medium bowl.  Warm up the soy milk in a microwavable cup for 15 seconds on high in the microwave.  Add about 1/3 of the sifted ingredients into the creamed butter mixture and beat them on low speed until they're just combined.  Add 1/4 cup of the soy milk into the mixture next, and beat until it's blended.  Add another 1/3 of the sifted ingredients into the mixture and beat on low until just combined.  Add another 1/4 cup of the soy milk to the mixture and mix it into the mixture.  Add the remaining dry ingredients into the mixture and beat until just combined.  Add the rest of the milk to the mixture and mix it until it's combined.  Use a rubber spatula to fold in half of the blueberries and all of your grated apple into the mixture.  Form the Cupcakes Spoon the mixture into the muffin tins. Each muffin cup should be about 3/4 filled to the top. Arrange the remaining blueberries on top of each cupcake.  Baking Bake your cupcakes for 12 to 15 minutes.  Use a toothpick to check if they're done.  Take the cupcakes out of the oven and let them sit on your counter for 10 minutes before taking them out of the tin.  Serve them with a hot cup of tea and a few fresh berries as garnish.
